entry.title: Update ScreenAIServiceRouter to pause connections till library is ready.
entry.content:
ScreenAIServiceRouter may receive connections before library is loaded

and initialized and ScreenAI service had to deprioritize all requeusts

until library is ready.

After this change, the connections are queued until the library is ready

and the service can be simplified (in a next CL) to run the requests as

they come.

entry.title: iwa: Handle CLI flags earlier during Chrome startup
entry.content:
This moves the call to `web_app::MaybeInstallIwaFromCommandLine` earlier

during startup processing, so that it is called in more startup

scenarios, such as when it is used in combination with

`--no-startup-window`. It now also prints a helpful error message in

case the profile picker would open during startup, suggesting to use the

`--profile-directory` flag to select the profile directory.



This also makes the chrome://flags flag that controlled the

installation from URL ChromeOS-only. It doesn't really make sense to

control IWA installation via that flag on other platforms, since you

should usually just launch the browser via command line. After all,

you likely don't want to re-install the same IWA whenever you open

your browser, which is what happens today if you set the flag in

chrome://flags. I kept the flag for ChromeOS, since it is currently

the best way to install an IWA on ChromeOS if your Chromebook is not

in developer mode.



Bug: 1426677, b/272471661, b/274758125

entry.title: [text-wrap-pretty] Fix `min-content` when `text-indent` is applied
entry.content:
This patch fixes `min-content` for `NGInlineNode` when

`text-indent` is applied. Before this patch, there were two

separate issues:

1. `HandleTextForFastMinContent` is an optimization for min-

and max-content by creating single item for the max-width

of all words in an `NGInlineItemResult`. The optimization

shouldn't apply when `text-indent` is applied, because the

first and following lines have different available widths.

2. When an instance of `NGLineBreaker` is reused multiple

times, it resets `is_first_formatted_line_` (and therefore

`text-indent`) only by `item_index`. This patch fixes it to

check `text_offset` as well.

`NGInlineNode::ComputeMinMaxSizes` is currently the only

callsites of `NGLineBreaker` that uses one instance

multiple times.



The fix 2 is also desired for `text-wrap: pretty`.

entry.title: Audio: Support AudioToolbox Channel layout re-mapping
entry.content:
CoreAudio has its own channel layout definition that has different

channel order than channel layout in chrome, so that means we must

manually do a channel layout re-mapping otherwise multi channel (

most likely a 5.1/7.1) audio will have incorrect channel output.



To support multi channel audio codecs eg: AC3/E-AC3, this has to be

landed firstly. It's hard to find some xHE-AAC samples though,

however if we force Chrome use AudioToolboxAudioDecoder decode

all AAC contents, then the issue can also be reproduced with

multi channel AAC samples!



TEST: manually verify with some mono/stereo/5.1/5.1_wide/7.1 AAC

audio that previously not output correctly on macOS.



Bug: 1430808

Bug: 611517

entry.title: Composited scroll-driven animations with non-composited scroll node
entry.content:
This will make things simple for ScrollUnification +

CompositeScrollAfterPaint, e.g. we no longer need to check composited

scrolling status when determining whether to composite a scroll-driven

animation.



It will also avoid main-thread

involvement for scroll-driven animations when we implement

raster-inducing scroll in the compositor thread for

non-composited scrollers.

entry.title: Extensions: FileHandlers: Open FH in a tab and treat MV3 QO as WFH
entry.content:
WFH: Web File Handlers

* Open WFH in a tab instead of a window without an Omnibox.

* Open MV3 QO Extensions as if they're WFH.



Allow the QuickOffice extension to use standard Web File Handlers when

it updates to use MV3 (the MV2 version currently has an exception carved

out to allow it use the app-based file handlers).



QuickOffice requested that WFH open in a tab instead of a window. They

said that WFH works fine when they don’t use their usual manifest key.

This aims to make WFH available regardless of whether the key is used.

entry.title: HttpCache: Remove NOTREACHED in RemoveEntry
entry.content:
net::disk_cache::BackendImpl::RemoveEntry would call NOTREACHED() if the

value it decremented went below zero. Since this value is on disk and

not under complete control of Chromium it is not appropriate to use

NOTREACHED() here.



Change it to STRESS_NOTREACHED() so that the invariant is still checked

when stress testing.



BUG=1431875



Change-Id: Ia3493e0b5d423b7a16be00a7377b0810d313a0af

entry.title: Clean up PrintManagerHost::SetupScriptedPrintPreview() mojo interface
entry.content:

interface, but the only caller does not take advantage of this

capability. It insteads treats SetupScriptedPrintPreview() as async and

gives it a callback. As such, remove the "Sync" attribute in the mojom

file.

entry.content:

the cast stream is distorted with ChromeCast with Google TV. It is due

cast device, this CL enables the vp8 hardware encoders on ChromeOS.

entry.title: WebNN: Re-enable the WPT
entry.content:
WebNN WPT tests were disabled because of the `gemm` op test failure that

prevents TFLite and XNNPACK weekly rolling CL [1]. This rolling includes

a XNNPACK commit that supports FP16 dynamic fully connected [2], however

the current WebNN WPT "gemm two float32 2D tensors (b is non-constant)

default options" test uses FP32 operands [3], which caused the failure.



This CL updates the WPT baseline according to the test results of the

new version of third_party/xnnpack and re-enables the WebNN WPT tests.

entry.title: Reland "media/gpu/VP8VaapiVED: Specify a loop filter level by rate controller"
entry.content:
This relands commit 94f4d69fa755b37caf26e9e87815cad9a58c175a.



The original CL causes a GPU process crash in checked_cast. It may be

the default implementation is called for some reason. This fixes the

issue by removing the default implementation.



Original change's description:

> media/gpu/VP8VaapiVED: Specify a loop filter level by rate controller

>

> Originally, we set the highest loop filter level, 63, all the time. It

> causes inefficiency in compression; an encoder driver produces the

> large chunk even for identical frames. We need to rather specify a

> smaller loop filter level [1].

> This CL specifies a loop filter level computed by a software rate

> controller to each frame.

>

> [1] Chapter 6. https://static.googleusercontent.com/media/research.google.com/ja//pubs/archive/37073.pdf

>

> Bug: b:253135900

> Test: ./video_encode_accelerator_tests youtube_screenshot_static.yuv --codec=vp8

> Change-Id: I4327f28fca86f10f0c079d131a0aa85991e1b4a9

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4421371

> Commit-Queue: Hirokazu Honda

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Reviewed-by: Justin Green

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1132871}

entry.title: exo: Update frame prior to bounds
entry.content:
This CL changes the calling order of `UpdateFrameType()` and bounds

update methods.

The frame type has to be updated before calculating the bounds because

the bounds computation depends on the frame type (e.g. caption height).

Without this CL, if the frame type and bounds changed in a single

commit, the bounds can be calculated with the previous frame type. The

wrong bounds get fixed on the next commit anyway, but there can be a

short period of time that the window has the wrong bounds.



Bug: b:279412451

Test: ClientControlledShellSurfaceTest.Frame

entry.title: [Extensions] Add userScript messaging events
entry.content:
Messages sent from an extension user script world (via

runtime.sendMessage() or runtime.connect()) should go to different

events in the extension trusted context. Instead of being dispatched to

runtime.onMessage and runtime.onConnect, they should be dispatched to

runtime.onUserScriptMessage and runtime.onUserScriptConnect. This allows

user script managers to better audit the messages coming in and

differentiate them from more trusted contexts.



Wire this up by introducing a new kUserScript type in

MessagingEndpoint::Type and leveraging that for user script-initiated

messages and connections. Add unit tests for determining the appropriate

event to use, as well as end-to-end browsertests for sending messages

and receiving replies in user script contexts.



Bug: 1429408

Change-Id: I22ca8f31dad609906d517bca6d5ebd318791abad

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4468968

entry.title: Reland Call CopySIToTexture in PaintCanvasVideoRenderer
entry.content:
This change relands CL - https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4350534 and partially also

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4386616



Original change didn't work as expected due to issues with resource

initialization missing which is fixed here - https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4450707



Original change description:

Update PaintCanvasVideoRenderer to use CopySharedImageToTexture

function on the GL passthrough decoder with SharedImageFormats. This

basically copies video frame shared image to a GL texture instead of

calling ConvertYUVToRGB call earlier for legacy formats. This is

used for use cases such as

1) uploading video frames to GL textures and

2) video frames used with WebGL.



It also moves some checks for GrContext and legacy mailbox for the

legacy shared image format type path.



Bug: 1366495

Test: Verified integration tests fail without fix in PS5

Change-Id: I43f2fc994184c09e98c48c9297f03ed2fa780ec8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4474989

entry.title: Process-per-Site up to a certain main frame count
entry.content:
This CL adds a new experimental process reuse policy that eagerly

reuses an available same-site process for all main frame navigations,

regardless of the soft limit, up to a certain number of main frames in

a process. A new feature flag and a threshold parameter are added to control the new reuse policy.



Design document:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o_eX1y_ra-P4HWVr-sulGw44NREiRcQ0J84SW01aSC4/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 1434900

entry.title: [dPWA] Fix install locally command for Synchronize to work
entry.content:
This CL fixes the InstallAppLocallyCommand for OS integration manager

to Synchronize changes effectively by setting the is_locally_installed

field before Synchronize happens. This allows the sub managers to

accurate design the desired states instead of skipping configuration

entirely.



This also adds some basic tests, and have been tested locally and by

running the WebAppIntegration sync integration tests.



There is a small chance that the app can be locally installed and a

crash may happen during OS integration being set, but the chances of that

are negligible.



Bug: b/279020571

Change-Id: I48e74f1cf1d27bf469011c0585ef0e22353018e6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4481339

Commit-Queue: Dibyajyoti Pal

Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1136242}

entry.title: capture_mode_polish: Pressing enter should select focused item
entry.content:
Currently, pressing enter performs the capture and ignores any

focused item that has been navigated to via the keyboard. This

creates a poor user experience.



Pressing the enter key should behave like pressing the space bar

if there's a focused item, otherwise it should perform the capture.



Fixed: b/279661654

Test: Manually, existing and new tests.

Change-Id: I3a9f0fee42ec8917977ae071de983937f28e9808

entry.title: Revert "WebView: Add monochrome finch smoke tests to internal.chrome.fyi"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a37392f12ff3a85950a33a207efe3ee8929c5160.



Reason for revert: Suspected culprit CL for crbug.com/1440542



Original change's description:

> WebView: Add monochrome finch smoke tests to internal.chrome.fyi

>

> If we add monochrome finch smoke tests to internal.chrome.fyi then we

> can store the test spec in the chromium public source repository. The

> test spec will then be packaged by the chrome orchestrator. The

> android-finch-smoke-test can then read the test spec from the

> package instead of reading it from the source code. The

> builder will no longer need to check out the chrome source code.

entry.title: [BestEffortServiceWorker] Enable the feature via hash based allowlist
entry.content:
This CL adds the allowlist support to RaceNetworkRequest. If the sha256

hash in ServiceWorkerVersion matches the list, the feature is enabled.

This mechanism will be used upcoming a/b experiment.



`FetchHandlerBypassedHashStrings` in

service_worker_controllee_request_handler.cc is moved to

`service_worker_loader_helpers` to avoid the code duplication between

ServiceWorkerControlleeRequestHandler and

ServiceWorkerMainResourceLoader.

entry.title: [FreezeCast] Fix DCHECK failures
entry.content:
cast_mirroring_service_host now retains a reference to

video_capture_host_, a weak_ptr. We were holding on to this reference

for too long in a few cases, which led to DCHECK failures. This change

ensures that we drop the reference in the cases where

video_capture_host_ will be invalidated.



Also, ensure that the UI is notified in that case that mirroring

resumes because the source has switched (tab switching).

entry.title: [media] Skip disabled MP4 tracks
entry.content:
MP4 tracks may be disabled by not setting the |track_enabled| bit.

FFmpeg exposes this via the |disposition| stream property.



The change is limited to the mov demuxer because the interpretation of

disabled tracks is less clearly defined for other containers. It would

likely make sense to always prefer DEFAULT disposition tracks, for all

containers.

entry.content:
If we add monochrome finch smoke tests to internal.chrome.fyi then we

can store the test spec in the chromium public source repository. The

test spec will then be packaged by the chrome orchestrator. The

android-finch-smoke-test can then read the test spec from the

package instead of reading it from the source code. The

builder will no longer need to check out the chrome source code.

entry.title: Reflow MV tiles when overflowing
entry.content:
Adds a feature flag and logic to support reflowing the MV tiles when

they overflow their container either due to changing browser window

widths or magnification settings. This is to ensure the MV tiles abides

by GAR 1.16b which requires that when a user magnifies the page, the

same content initially visible be present. (See: go/GAR-web#run-through)



The 'cr-most-visited' component is used by both 1st party and 3rd party

NTPs. At this time, the current fix only applies to the 1st party

experience. Once deemed successful, follow up work will enable this

reflow behavior on the 3rd party NTP experience.



Demo(s):

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QhDxtuewP02kjIPmhOhHAEMY9UYP_fBf

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZS5YRisf70GbA4NvxKCMx7t1sxBbCOSR/view

entry.title: Reland "Add chronos-access group read access to downloads service directory."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 7c0d86a0f39e728e052f15424af632cbfb9bd524



I typo was not caught as for some reasons downloads in Chrome still

worked without download service.

pita.Install Tast test caught the issue and is now passing.



Original change's description:

> Add chronos-access group read access to downloads service directory.

>

> The system-created directories in ChromeOS cryptohome

> (.../MyFiles/ and .../MyFiles/Downloads/) have read access

> for chronos-access group members, unlike the downloads service

> directory created by Chrome.

> This way members of chronos-access group, e.g.DLP can't access

> the folder content.

>

> This CL changes access mode from 711 to 751 and changes group

> ownership from chronos to chronos-access.

>

> Bug: b:277595762

> Test: Check that the folder has proper ownership.

> Change-Id: I2c7b21c4fbf298e9774b9d77f211e8eb9fcc9f78

entry.title: Lock variables on the stack for hang investigation
entry.content:
In order to understand why Chrome sometimes hangs during shutdown while

deleting files it is useful to know how many files Chrome is trying to

delete, and how many it has deleted. This will indicate whether a

single delete operation is hanging, or if the problem is trying to

delete too many files.

entry.title: Log interaction for when user leaves interstitial without using the UI
entry.content:
As part of expanding anti-phishing telemetry, we want to know if users

are deciding not to proceed through means other than the interstitial UI

("Back to Safety" button). This will help us understand how effective

our UI is at warning users about phishing sites. We also added logging

for user action sequences for interactions with the phishing

interstitial.

entry.title: [ImmersiveFullscreen] fix up window tree
entry.content:
Remove the overlay window from the browser window before moving the

overlay window to the fullscreen window. Leaving a dangling reference to

the overlay window on the browser window causes some odd child window

behavior. Including the issue described in bug 1434972 (child window not

moving with the parent).



Also remove shadows from the overlay and tab windows.



Also fix some typos in the surrounding comments.

entry.title: [infra] Disable reuse for win-presubmit.
entry.content:
In addition to controlling whether builds can be reused, disable_reuse

also determine whether a builder is considered a presubmit builder and

therefore skipped by No-Presubmit. This change disables reuse for

win-presubmit so that it will be skipped by the No-Presubmit footer as

expected.

entry.title: mp4muxer: Box writer base class
entry.content:
The box writer class is a base call for all upcoming

box classes. It provides two abstract methods of

Write and GetSize, and multiple protected methods.



It also has box types that has only Box and FullBox

now, but will have MP4 specific boxes in following

CL.



The unit test has a pattern how boxes will derived from

the writer class and implement methods.
